articles.title: UMass student suspended after organizing protest sues university
articles.description:
Kivlighan de Montebello says the university punished him for a peaceful protest targeting defense contractor RTX.

The post UMass student suspended after organizing protest sues university appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Kivlighan de Montebello, a UMass student, was suspended for organizing a protest against RTX.
The protest was peaceful and aimed at raising awareness about defense contractors on campus.
De Montebello's lawsuit could impact free speech policies at UMass and similar universities.

articles.title: More details emerge about children charged with murder in R.I.
articles.description:
The preteens were arrested after a separate disturbance near the scene of the fatal Jan. 19 beating.

The post More details emerge about children charged with murder in R.I. appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Preteens arrested for murder after a disturbance on January 19 in Rhode Island.
The incident raises concerns about youth violence in nearby Boston communities.
Local authorities emphasize the need for increased youth intervention programs.

articles.title: Allandale Farm loses second Highland steer following brother’s death last year
articles.description:
Curtis, a longtime presence at Boston’s only working farm, has died peacefully at age 16.

The post Allandale Farm loses second Highland steer following brother’s death last year appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Allandale Farm's Highland steer, Curtis, died peacefully at age 16.
Curtis was the second Highland steer lost in a year at the farm.
The loss affects community engagement at Boston's only working farm.

articles.title: Senate passes Trump-backed government funding deal, sending to House
articles.description:
Senate Democrats will not support an extension of Homeland Security funding in two weeks “unless it reins in ICE and ends violence,” Schumer said.

The post Senate passes Trump-backed government funding deal, sending to House appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Senate passes Trump-backed funding deal, impacting Boston's federal funding.
Democrats, led by Schumer, oppose ICE funding unless reforms are made.
Potential government shutdown could affect local services in Boston.
